text_devanagari: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच। धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः।
text_iast: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca | dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ |
notes: Opening of the Bhagavad Gita - Dhritarashtra speaks to Sanjaya

text_iast: māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāścaiva kimakurvata sañjaya |
notes: What did my people and the Pandavas do, O Sanjaya?

text_iast: karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana |
notes: Famous verse on karma yoga - you have right to action, not to fruits

text_iast: mā karmaphalahetur bhūr mā te saṅgo 'stvakarmaṇi |
notes: Never be motivated by results, nor be attached to inaction

text_devanagari: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय।
text_iast: yogasthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā dhanañjaya |
notes: Established in yoga, perform actions abandoning attachment

text_iast: yogaḥ karmasu kauśalam |
notes: Famous definition: Yoga is skill in action

text_devanagari: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत।
text_iast: yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārata |
notes: Whenever there is decline of dharma, O Bharata

text_iast: paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṃ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām |
notes: For protection of the good and destruction of evil-doers

text_iast: sarvadharmān parityajya mām ekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja |
notes: Abandoning all dharmas, take refuge in Me alone

text_devanagari: ॐ ईशावास्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत्।
text_iast: oṃ īśāvāsyam idaṃ sarvaṃ yat kiñca jagatyāṃ jagat |
notes: Opening verse: All this is pervaded by the Lord

text_devanagari: तेन त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथा मा गृधः कस्यस्विद्धनम्।
text_iast: tena tyaktena bhuñjīthāḥ mā gṛdhaḥ kasya svid dhanam |
notes: Enjoy through renunciation; do not covet anyone's wealth

text_iast: aṇor aṇīyān mahato mahīyān ātmā asya jantor nihito guhāyām |
notes: The Self is smaller than small, greater than great, hidden in the heart

text_devanagari: नायमात्मा प्रवचनेन लभ्यो न मेधया न बहुना श्रुतेन।
text_iast: nāyam ātmā pravacanena labhyo na medhayā na bahunā śrutena |
notes: This Self cannot be obtained by instruction, intellect, or much learning

text_iast: nāntaḥprajñaṃ na bahiṣprajñaṃ nobhayataḥprajñam |
notes: Turiya state: neither inward nor outward knowing

text_iast: tat tvam asi śvetaketo |
notes: Great saying: Thou art That, Svetaketu

text_iast: ahaṃ brahmāsmi |
notes: Great saying: I am Brahman

text_devanagari: सर्वं खल्विदं ब्रह्म तज्जलानिति शान्त उपासीत।
text_iast: sarvaṃ khalv idaṃ brahma tajjalān iti śānta upāsīta |
notes: All this is indeed Brahman; worship in tranquility

text_devanagari: सत्यमेव जयते नानृतं सत्येन पन्था विततो देवयानः।
text_iast: satyam eva jayate nānṛtaṃ satyena panthā vitato devayānaḥ |
notes: Truth alone triumphs, not falsehood; by truth the divine path is spread

text_iast: oṃ bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ tat savitur vareṇyam |
notes: Gayatri mantra first half: Om, earth, atmosphere, heaven, that excellent light of Savitri

text_devanagari: भर्गो देवस्य धीमहि धियो यो नः प्रचोदयात्।
text_iast: bhargo devasya dhīmahi dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt |
notes: Gayatri mantra second half: We meditate on the effulgence of that divine Being; may He direct our intellects

text_devanagari: एकं सद्विप्रा बहुधा वदन्त्यग्निं यमं मातरिश्वानमाहुः।
text_iast: ekaṃ sad viprā bahudhā vadanty agniṃ yamaṃ mātariśvānam āhuḥ |
notes: Truth is one; wise call it by many names - Agni, Yama, Matarishvan

text_devanagari: नासदासीन्नो सदासीत्तदानीं नासीद्रजो नो व्योमा परो यत्।
text_iast: nāsad āsīn no sad āsīt tadānīṃ nāsīd rajo no vyomā paro yat |
notes: Nasadiya Sukta: Neither non-existence nor existence was then

text_iast: agnim īḷe purohitaṃ yajñasya devam ṛtvijam |
notes: Opening verse of Rig Veda: I praise Agni, the priest, divine minister of sacrifice

text_devanagari: ॐ शं नो मित्रः शं वरुणः शं नो भवत्वर्यमा।
text_iast: oṃ śaṃ no mitraḥ śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavatv aryamā |
notes: Peace invocation: May Mitra, Varuna, and Aryaman grant us peace

text_iast: oṃ pūrṇam adaḥ pūrṇam idaṃ pūrṇāt pūrṇam udacyate |
notes: Peace mantra: That is complete, this is complete, from complete comes complete

text_iast: pūrṇasya pūrṇam ādāya pūrṇam evāvaśiṣyate |
notes: Taking complete from complete, complete alone remains

text_iast: oṃ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ |
notes: Triple peace: Om, peace, peace, peace
